definition: Instructions to buy, sell, or cancel transactions in financial markets or securities trading

positive_examples: The trader placed a buy order for 100 shares of Apple stock
Her broker filled the sell order at the market price
He cancelled his pending order before the market closed
The limit order was executed when the stock hit $50
She modified her stop-loss order to protect her gains
The day trader's order was partially filled during morning volatility
negative_examples: The company completed its merger with the competitor
He transferred money from his checking to savings account
She received her quarterly dividend payment
The bank approved his mortgage loan application
They split the restaurant bill three ways
The insurance claim was processed successfully
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: PaymentProcessing, AccountTransfers, LoanTransactions, DividendPayments
